lines.content: E | 0 | Yogi attend CS2113 lecture Friday 21 Feb 2025 (from: 4 to: 6pm)

Welcome to Asep, your personal task management chatbot. Asep helps you efficiently manage your tasks by allowing you to add todos, deadlines, and events, as well as update, delete, and search through your tasks via simple text commands.

Asep is a command-line based chatbot designed to simplify task management. Whether you need to remember to read a book, submit an assignment, or attend a meeting, Asep is here to help. This guide provides step-by-step instructions on how to use Asep's features.
To start using Asep, run the application. Once running, you can begin entering commands. For a quick overview, try the following:
- Type `list` to display your current tasks.
- Type `todo` followed by a task description to add a todo.
- Type `deadline` or `event` to add tasks with specific timings.
- Use `mark`, `unmark`, and `delete` to manage your tasks.
To add a todo, use the `todo` command followed by your task description.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
To add a deadline task, use the `deadline` command with the task description, and specify the due date using `/by` in the format `yyyy-MM-dd`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
To add an event task, use the `event` command with the task description, and specify the start and end times using `/from` and `/to`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
To mark a task as completed, use the `mark` command followed by the task number.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
To mark a task as not done, use the `unmark` command followed by the task number.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
To delete a task, use the `delete` command followed by the task number.
Now you have X tasks in the list.
To view all your tasks, simply type the `list` command.
To search for tasks that contain a specific keyword, use the `find` command followed by the keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
To exit the application, type the `bye` command.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
| `mark`     | `mark <task number>`                             | Marks a task as completed                  |
| `unmark`   | `unmark <task number>`                           | Marks a task as not completed              |
If you need further assistance, please refer to the documentation provided with Asep or contact our support team.
* Represents the main application class for Asep.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and task list, loads tasks from file,
* and runs the main command processing loop.
* The main entry point of the Asep application.
* Determines the directory of the running JAR file and uses it to set the file path.
// Determine the folder where the JAR file is located.
// Set the data file path to be in the same directory as the JAR.
* Represents an abstract command in the Asep application.
* All commands must implement the execute method to define their specific actions
* on the task list, user interface, and storage.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks   the task list to operate on.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage the storage handler for data persistence.
* @throws AsepException if an error occurs during command execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AsepException;
* Indicates whether this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return false by default; override in exit commands to return true.
* Represents a deadline task with a specified due date.

* The date format used for parsing input dates in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* The date format used for displaying dates in the format "MMM dd yyyy".
public static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_DATE_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and due date.
* @param description the description of the task.
* @param by the due date for the task.
* Returns the due date of this deadline task.
* Returns the type identifier of this task.
* For a deadline task, the type is represented by the letter "D".
* @return a string "D" representing a deadline task.
* Returns additional information about the task.
* For a deadline task, this includes the formatted due date.
* @return a string containing the due date formatted using OUTPUT_DATE_FORMAT.
* Represents a command to add a new deadline task.
* This command creates a Deadline task using the provided description and due date,
* adds it to the task list, saves the updated list to storage, and displays a confirmation message.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the specified task description and due date.
* @param description the description of the deadline task.
* @param by the due date of the deadline task.

* saving the updated list to storage, and displaying a confirmation message.
* @param tasks the task list to which the new deadline task is added.
* @param ui the user interface used to display messages.
* @param storage the storage system used to persist the task list.
* @throws AsepException if an error occurs while saving the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AsepException {
// Pass the TaskList directly since Storage.saveTasks expects a TaskList.

"\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");

* Represents a command to mark a task as completed.
* This command marks the task at the specified index as done, updates the storage,
* and displays a confirmation message to the user.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the index of the task to be marked as done.
* Executes the mark command by marking the task at the given index as done.
* The method first validates that the provided index is within the bounds of the task list.
* If the index is invalid, an AsepException is thrown. Otherwise, the task is marked as done,
* the updated task list is saved to storage, and a confirmation message is displayed.
* @param tasks   the task list containing all tasks.
* @param ui      the user interface used for displaying messages.
* @param storage the storage system used to persist the task list.
* @throws AsepException if the provided index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AsepException {
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n   " + tasks.get(index));
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user input commands
* and converting them into corresponding Command objects.
* It supports various commands such as "bye", "list", "mark", "unmark", "delete",
* "todo", "deadline", "event", and "find". If the command or its format is invalid,
* Parses a full command string and returns the appropriate Command object.
* The method determines the command type based on the first word of the input,
* extracts necessary arguments, and creates a corresponding Command instance.

*
  • "mark", "unmark", and "delete" for task operations (requires a task number)

*
  • "todo" for adding a todo task (requires a description)

*
  • "deadline" for adding a deadline task (requires a description and a date)

*
  • "event" for adding an event task (requires a description, start, and end time)

*
  • "find" for searching tasks by a keyword
* @param fullCommand the full command input from the user.
* @return a Command object corresponding to the parsed command.
* @throws AsepException if the command is unrecognized or if its format is invalid.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws AsepException {
throw new AsepException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new AsepException("Invalid deadline format. Use: deadline <desc> /by <date>");
throw new AsepException("Deadline description and date cannot be empty.");
throw new AsepException("Invalid date format. Please use yyyy-MM-dd.");
throw new AsepException("Invalid event format. Use: event <desc> /from <start> /to <end>");
throw new AsepException("Event description, start, and end times cannot be empty.");
throw new AsepException("Search term cannot be empty.");
throw new AsepException("Oops! I don't recognize this command. Please try again.");
* Parses the task index from a command string.
* This helper method extracts the task number from commands that operate on tasks,
* such as "mark", "unmark", and "delete". The method expects the command to contain
* exactly two parts: the command word and the task number. The task number is converted
* from a 1-based index to a 0-based index.
* @param fullCommand the full command string which includes a task number.
* @return the zero-based index of the task.
* @throws AsepException if the command format is incorrect or if the task number is invalid.
private static int parseTaskIndex(String fullCommand) throws AsepException {
throw new AsepException("Invalid command format. Usage: <command> <task number>");
